data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Nzwani, Comoros. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Nzwani, Comoros
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Jesus, help the church in the state of Nzwani to not rely on buildings or programs, but on your Spirit and the simple faithfulness of every believer.
Spirit, give the disciples of the the state of Nzwani words, actions, signs and wonders to proclaim the coming of the Kingdom.
data.verse: As you go, proclaim this message: "The kingdom of heaven has come near."

data.prayer: Spirit, help the disciples in the state of Nzwani to find a person of peace today, like the Philippian jailer, who heard and was immediately baptized with his whole family.
data.verse: And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house. And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their wounds; and he was baptized at once, he and all his family.

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Comorian, Ngazidja people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Father, we ask for 7 new simple churches in the state of Nzwani, Comoros. Place a simple church in every community of the 38,000 people living here.
data.verse: And blessed be His glorious name forever; And may the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen, and Amen.

data.prayer: Father, it’s possible most of the 37,317 lost people in  Nzwani, Comoros have never held or opened a Bible. Please change this, Father.
data.verse: Yet faith comes from listening to this Good News—the Good News about Christ.

data.prayer: Father, thank you that in your kindness you have made every believer in Nzwani, Comoros a priest, who can offer spiritual sacrifices to you through Jesus.
data.verse: Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit. He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”

location.name: Nzwani
location.people_groups_list: Makua, Makhuwa-Meetto, Swahili, Deaf, Malay, Arab
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Makua, Makhuwa-Meetto (14,000), Swahili (1,100), Deaf (8,700), Malay (1,000), Arab (900)
